intro: Derris maingayana, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Loganiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles containing elongated seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Derris maingayana is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies.
